title: The Government must help grieving families who seek justice abroad
text:
To lose a loved one to homicide is a horrific and devastating experience, no matter where the crime takes place. But for bereaved families dealing with a homicide in a foreign country, their loss can be compounded by having to contend with a bewildering range of financial, legal and logistical obstacles

The Foreign and Commonwealth estimates that every year between 60-90 British citizens lose their lives under violent and, or suspicious circumstances, mostly as a result of murder or manslaughter. My report, published today, “Struggling for Justice” looks at the entitlements and experiences of the families of those who have died.
